TopicTitle: Here's a stock dragon. (Like, the flying reptile.) .Craft File is Out!

Articles.Content:
I've been working on this for a couple of days now... it's pretty sweet and actually surprisingly stable.

The Dragon is meant to terrorize the poor, simple villagers around the KSC. Kerbals are thus provided as sacrifices to prevent the mighty dragon from attacking. These "sacrifices" are then trained to be astronauts, and launched into space. While frowned upon by Kerbal rights activists, this process has been proven to be very reliable and is now frequently used by KSP staff.

[EDIT: Here's some images of the completed Dragon!]

...as compared to the WIP Dragon...

... and here's the Dropbox File! https://www.dropbox.com/s/r3re345mvwbpg7r/Dragon.craft

Edited July 9, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace
Adding Things!
That looks pretty good, I can't wait until the file is released. Plus on rep!

'You should have acted, they're already here. The elder boosters told of their return. Their staging error was merely a delay. For the time after the Kraken-world opened, when the sons of Kerbin would spill their own fuel. No-one wanted to believe, believe they even exist. And when the truth finally dawns, it dawns in explosions. But, there is one they fear. In their tongue, he is Boosterkiin; Jebediah Kerman!'

FUS RO BOOM!

What? You've got to give me some credit for that! Anyway, nice dragon. For a minute, I thought you meant Space-X, but seeing an actual dragon was much better than I was expecting

I've been working on this for a couple of days now... it's pretty sweet and actually surprisingly stable.

The Dragon is meant to terrorize the poor, simple villagers around the KSC. Kerbals are thus provided as sacrifices to prevent the mighty dragon from attacking. These "sacrifices" are then trained to be astronauts, and launched into space. While frowned upon by Kerbal rights activists, this process has been proven to be very reliable and is now frequently used by KSP staff.

I'll release the Dropbox file once I'm satisfied with this design. In the meantime, do you have any feedback?

Pretty sweet indeed. Does that glide on ions and VTOLS (and firebreaths) on rockets? It should.

Rune. Here, a cookie for your troubles!

I came here expecting this type of Dragon

I was pleasantly surprised.

Wow. This design seems to be rather popular.

That looks pretty good, I can't wait until the file is released.

The title has been changed, so hopefully no more confusion. I wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t even thinking about the Dragon spacecraft when I made this, so sorry for that.

.craft file is here!

If you don't want to read the instructions or if you want to view the Dragon in flight before you fly it yourself, here's a Promotional Video!

Let me know if anything is broken or weird, and I'll try to fix it right away.

This actually brings me to a question. The Dragon looks cool enough... but how does it fly? I think I'm too used to its quirks to provide an accurate judgement...

If y'all have the spare time, can you give me some feedback about the Dragon's performance in the air? I'm detecting a little instability that would maybe be fixable, if I knew what was causing it. It shows up at high speeds, and when pitching up or down a lot.

Once again, thanks for all of the +Rep, the nice comments and the suggestions! I really love your feedback... the Forum is such a great place.
nice work with the wings
Put an LVT 30 in its face. Fire makes everything better
Tweakables.

Put an LVT 30 in its face. Fire makes everything better
Tweakables.

I think that one of the really great things about this craft is the fact that it's 100% stock. The only other dragon on the forum, The Destroyer's Toothless, requires a load of mods to function. This isn't really a bad thing, but I much prefer all-stock builds. In this case, at least, they seem to require a little more skill to pull off, and I like showing off whatever I can do well in KSP (which is not a lot, actually).

Since making the Dragon, I've been experimenting around with other animal-shaped designs:

...oh, and I'll probably revise the images on the first page to include the (somewhat-better-looking) completed dragon.
